definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
for the benefit of the reader

sentences.english: Reading comprehension is a reading process where readers can construct the meaning of version.
sentences.chinese: 讀解就是讀者建構文本意義的閱讀過程。

sentences.english: From time to time, some of my readers take a stab at converting me to their religion.
sentences.chinese: 我的一些讀者時常嘗試把我轉變成他們的宗教的信徒。

sentences.english: Most readers are probably familiar with the Dilbert comic strip.
sentences.chinese: 很多讀者可能對Dilbert連環畫都很熟悉。

sentences.english: There is the reader. There is God.
Most readers, in fact, understand the novel pretty well.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，大多數讀者都深刻理解了這部小說。

sentences.english: The larger the font size is, the easier it is for readers to actually read the text presented on a given web-page.
sentences.chinese: 字體越大，讀者越容易看到呈現在網頁上的內容。

sentences.english: It is never my intention to be rude or to give well-meaning readers the cold shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 我絕對沒有要對我的讀者耍酷的意圖。

sentences.english: The thesis mainly demonstrates the securitization from the perspective of Cross-Border.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要從跨國性的視角向讀者展示資產證券化。

sentences.english: The unfinalizability of dialogue forces reader to find the truth of the Sutpen s tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 對話的未終結性迫使讀者參與到找出真相的活動中來。

sentences.english: Each door opens onto another country. We readers have unprecedented rights of access to complementary and contradictory worlds.
sentences.chinese: 作爲讀者，我們有權進入互不相同或完全對立的世界。

sentences.english: Specifically, in the blogosphere, the vast majority of blogs have very few readers.
sentences.chinese: 特別是在博客圈，大多數的博客都只有寥寥幾名讀者。

sentences.english: Viewers around the world can catch a live webcast of the sold-out event in New York.
sentences.chinese: 全球的讀者可通過網路來觀看這一討論的現場情況。

sentences.english: His tone can be alarmingly inconsequential, as if the reader is there to be perpetually wrong-footed.
sentences.chinese: 他的語氣極其不合邏輯，好像讀者永遠都站不對陣腳。

sentences.english: Most viewers can empathize with the sense of hesitation and uncertainty embodied in such an image.
sentences.chinese: 大多數讀者都能感受到這幅畫中包含的猶豫和彷徨。

sentences.english: Ulysses is not difficult to read, and it richly rewards each reader in wisdom and pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 尤利西斯》不難讀，它會給每位讀者以智慧和愉悅。

sentences.english: What is the status of identification?
sentences.chinese: 讀者把自己代入書中角色時情況會如何？

definition: the masses/the great bulk of the population/popular (of music, science etc)
(of an area) vast or extensive/large-scale/widespread/(of people) numerous
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
